welcome.abstract: This screen needs to be cleaned-up.

screen1.title: IRMA is your mobile identity
screen1.text: Your official name, date of birth, address, and more. All safely stored in your IRMA app.

screen2.title: Reveal your identity with IRMA
screen2.text: Easy, safe, and fast. Only you have control.

screen3.title: IRMA provides certainty, to you and to others
screen3.text: Your data are stored solely within the IRMA app. Only you have access.

choose_pin.title: Choose PIN
choose_pin.error: PINs do not match. Choose a new PIN.

provide_email.title: Add an email address
provide_email.instruction: An email address allows you to disable your IRMA app when your mobile has been lost or stolen.
provide_email.error: This is not a valid email address
provide_email.skip_content: Protect your data. When you enter an email address, you can to disable your IRMA app when your mobile has been lost or stolen.

about.title: About IRMA
about.slogan: With IRMA only you have control over your data.
about.who_is_behind_irma_item: Who is behind the IRMA app?
about.who_is_behind_irma_explanation:
IRMA is produced by the **Privacy by Design** foundation. In 2016 this foundation grew out of the Digital Security research group at Radboud University Nijmegen. This foundation is independent and non-profit.

The IRMA app is open source and is developed jointly with SIDN, the manager of the .nl-domain. This development is done jointly with local government and health care. Some 30 municipalities are involved, including Nijmegen, Amsterdam and Leiden. IRMA is recipient of the Dutch Privacy Awards 2018.
about.why_irma_explanation:
**IRMA exists because you have the right to an online identity that you really own.** IRMA is not a commercial app that is used to track you, to profile you and to sell your personal data to third parties.

IRMA is in the spirit of the [General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR)](https://gdpr-info.eu/). Via the IRMA app you disclose only these data about yourself that are relevant and necessary in a particular situation.

**With the IRMA app your identity is in your own hands, within the secured IRMA app on your own phone.** The IRMA app is is a powerful means for making yourself known (online) and for digital signing. With respect for your privacy.
about.privacy_explanation:
The IRMA app has been developed in such a way that you and only you can see and use your personal data. Your personal data are stored only on your phone and not in the cloud.

The IRMA app is designed so that a website or shop where you make yourself known can (cryptographically) check that the data that you disclose are genuine.

The IRMA app discloses your data directly from your phone to the website. No-one else can see that you identify yourself there. Even the organisation behind IRMA cannot observe such disclosures. 

When using IRMA, you agree with the privacy policy [link].
about.responsibility_explanation:
A website that offers an IRMA long asks data that are needed for this login. Within the IRMA app you decide whether you agree (or not) with the requested disclosure.
Does the website ask too much data? Then it is wise not to agree. You can consider filing a complaint. You can do so at the website itself or at the [Data Protection Authorities](https://autoriteitpersoonsgegevens.nl/nl/zelf-doen/gebruik-uw-privacyrechten/klacht-melden-bij-de-ap).

With the IRMA app you can also put a digital signatures. Such a signature can have (legal) consequences. Hence, putting a digital signature with the IRMA app requires care.

If you put a digital signature with the IRMA app, you agree that the Privacy by Design foundation is in no way a party in any agreement that you enter into via an IRMA signature. The foundation is neither responsible nor liable.
about.share_text: Check out the IRMA app: https://www.irma.app

manual.faq_info: How to use IRMA? See the explanations below.
manual.question_1: How to use IRMA for logging onto a mobile website?

answer_1.step_1: Open the website on your mobile and select logging in with IRMA.
answer_1.step_2:
The IRMA app starts automatically.
Enter your PIN.
answer_1.step_3: Agree (or disagree) to disclose your personal data.
answer_1.step_4:
After disclosing you are logged in.
You can now use the website.

manual.question_2: How to use IRMA for logging onto a website on my computer?

answer_2.step_1: Open the website on your computer and select logging in with IRMA.
answer_2.step_2: Open the IRMA app on your mobile and enter your PIN.
answer_2.step_3: Start the QR code scanner in the IRMA app. Scan the QR code on the screen of your computer.
answer_2.step_4: Agree (or not) to disclose your personal data.
answer_2.step_5:
After disclosing you are logged in.
You can now use the website.

help.title: Help
help.faq_info: Check if your question is listed here
help.question_1: What can I do with IRMA?
help.answer_1:
With IRMA it's easy to log in and make yourself known. You disclose only the necessary attributes of yourself. For instance, in order to watch a certain movie, you disclose that you are over 16 years old and nothing else. With IRMA you can digitally sign documents too. You only use relevant characteristics of of yourself, in some sort of digital stamp. In this way IRMA allows you to sign as medical doctor, as citizen, or in some other role.

More and more websites support logging in with IRMA. For instance, doctors in The Netherlands can access medical dossiers via the website [helder](https://www.helder.health/). IRMA support is growing especially at municipalities and health care providers. To get an idea of the possibilities, you can try out yourself some of the available IRMA [demo's](https://privacybydesign.foundation/demo-en/).
help.question_2: What to do if I lose my mobile?
help.answer_2:
If you lose your mobile, nobody can use your IRMA app, at least if you have chosen a non-trivial PIN.

You can protect yourself even more: upon installing IRMA you have been given the choice to enter an email address. If you have done so, you can block your IRMA app altogether via [MyIRMA](https://privacybydesign.foundation/myirma/). The IRMA app on your old (lost) mobile is then completely unusable.

If you have not yet added an email address in [MyIRMA](https://privacybydesign.foundation/myirma/) you can still do so now. This is recommended.

On your new mobile you can re-install the IRMA app and re-fill it with your data. Then you are good to go again.
help.question_3: What makes IRMA privacy-friendly and secure?
help.answer_3:
Your personal data are protected via your personal PIN. Your data are stored exclusively in the IRMA app and not in the cloud.

The data in your IRMA app are digitally signed by the source (issuer) where the data come from (such as the local authorities).

In this way a website or shop, where you make yourself known, can cryptographically verify that your data are genuine.
This exchange of personal data happens directly between your mobile and the website. No one else can see that you make yourself known there, not even the organisation behind IRMA.
help.question_4: Where are my IRMA data stored?
help.answer_4:
Your data are stored in the IRMA app on your mobile and not in the cloud.

You explicitly agree (or not) to reveal your personal data from your IRMA app to a website.
When you remove your data from the IRMA app, they are really gone from IRMA.
help.question_5: Why do the data in the IRMA app have limited validity?
help.answer_5:
Every card in IRMA shows its validity. The validity period depends on the kind of data on the card and how stable these data are. Your name and date of birth data are valid for five years, but your address data only one year. The source (issuer) of the data determines this validity period. The cards in your IRMA app may thus expire. The IRMA app then gives you a warning.

You can always, also without such a warning, refresh your cards by reloading them from the source. For instance, after year 18th birthday you can reload your data from your municipality so that you can prove that you are older than 18 now.
help.question_6: Can I install IRMA on a second mobile or tablet?
help.answer_6: Yes, on every (Android of iOS) device you can open a separate IRMA account fill it with cards with your data. It is wise to do so. If you lose one device, you can still log on with your other device.
help.send: Do you have other/more questions? Send an email. It may take a couple of days before you get a reply.

reset_pin.title: Lost PIN
reset_pin.message: Lost your PIN? We're sorry but the IRMA organization does not keep record of your PIN. If you wish to continue using IRMA, you will have to enter a new PIN and re-enter all data.
reset_pin.existing_data_title: What happens with my old cards?
reset_pin.existing_data_message: Your old cards will be deleted from your phone. If you like, you can collect new cards and start using IRMA again.
reset_pin.existing_data_removed: All cards in your IRMA app are deleted.

arrow_back.info_1: You could not be send back automatically.
arrow_back.safari: Click on the name of your browser (e.g., Safari, Chrome, Firefox)
arrow_back.info_2: in the top left corner to return to the website you were coming from.
